```python
import os

os.environ["DB_HOST"] = "localhost"
os.environ["DB_USER"] = "default_user"
os.environ["DB_PASSWORD"] = "default_password"
os.environ["DB_NAME"] = "default_database"

with open(".example.env", "w") as f:
    for key, value in os.environ.items():
        f.write(f"{key}={value}\n")
```
